speaker: Tomb of Names
lines: You enter a room of slate shelves holding name-stones.
Some stones are chipped; some are missing.
A brush and a pot of milk paint sit on a stool.
Dust lifts in the light as you breathe.
A space on the third shelf sits empty.
On the wall: 'Add nothing you won't carry.'
Beside it: 'Carry nothing you won't add.'

choices.text: Paint your name and place it on the shelf.
Paint a lost name you dreamt long ago.
Leave the brush clean and go.
